result.execSummary:
The defendant Paris Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Paris Brown is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Paris Brown was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paris Brown

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
15A 031340
Had money moved and re-applied as restitution was not fully paid the first time money was applied.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:   Defendant sentenced to serve 45 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 1 day time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 9 months.  If revoked, Huber privileges for work.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
     *   Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed
          medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.   
     *   Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant NOT possess or
          use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.
     *   No contact with victim, Dominique B., unless approved by the agent. Restitution is set at $143.48. Payable to Dominique B.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges by 6/24/16 or entry of a civil judgment. Cash bail to apply to restituion first, then costs and surcharges.
     *   Obtain and maintain employment, school, or combination of both.
     *   No firearms; dangerous weapons.
 Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights and Pretrial Incarceration Credit, received and filed.

Defendant Paris Brown in court with attorney Ann M Heaps.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.  Case calendared for plea/sentencing hearing.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

AS TO COUNT 2: On motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed.

Defendant Paris Brown in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreed Upon Request For A New Court Date received and filed with court.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Dominque B.

Defendant Paris Brown in court.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  


Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge T. Christopher Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 37 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05-22-2015

05-22-2015
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 6/19/15 @ 1:30 pm
